data.title: The Imaginary Anime Film Reveals Additional Cast
data.meta_description: Teiya Ichiryūsai, Mitsuaki Kanuka, Ikue Ōtani, Kokoro Hirasawa, Eito Kawahara join cast
data.text:
The official website for Studio Ponoc's anime film of A.F. Harrold and Emily Gravett's The Imaginary novel announced additional cast on Tuesday.

The newly announced cast includes (pictured above from left to right):

Teiya Ichiryūsai as Honneko Garigari

Mitsuaki Kanuka as Koyuki

Ikue Ōtani as Doron

Kokoro Hirasawa as Julia

Eito Kawahara as John

The film's main cast includes:

Kokoro Terada as Rudger

Rio Suzuki as Amanda

Sakura Andō as Lizzie

Riisa Naka as Emily

Takayuki Yamada as Jinzan

Atsuko Takahata as Downbeat Grandma

Issey Ogata as Mr. Bunting

Akira Terao as Old Dog

Hana Sugisaki as Aurora

Studio Ponoc stated it will have more announcements soon for the film, including the English voice cast.

The film will open in Japan on December 15 with the title Yaneura no Rudger (Rudger in the Attic).

Studio Ponoc delayed the film last year from its original summer 2022 release date due to "new challenges" stemming from the film's production methods and the COVID-19 pandemic.

Yoshiyuki Momose ("Life Ain't Gonna Lose" short in Ponoc's Modest Heroes anime anthology, Ni no Kuni film, Ponoc's Olympic Games short "Tomorrow's Leaves") is directing the film. Yoshiaki Nishimura — a producer on numerous Studio Ghibli films, as well as Ponoc films Mary and The Witch's Flower and Modest Heroes — is producing the film.

A Great Big World ("Say Something") featuring Rachel Platten ("Fight Song") are performing the theme song "Nothing's Impossible."

-Bloomsbury Publishing released A.F. Harrold's original The Imaginary novel in 2001 with illustrations by Emily Gravett. The publisher describes the novel:

Rudger is Amanda Shuffleup's imaginary friend. Nobody else can see Rudger--until the evil Mr. Bunting arrives at Amanda's door. Mr. Bunting hunts imaginaries. Rumor has it that he even eats them. And now he's found Rudger.

Soon Rudger is alone, and running for his imaginary life. He needs to find Amanda before Mr. Bunting catches him--and before Amanda forgets him and he fades away to nothing. But how can an unreal boy stand alone in the real world?
